Detailed Description

This class is a waypoint as it exists in a chunk, when fully loaded.

Member Function Documentation

void ChunkWaypoint::calcCentre ( const ChunkWaypointVertexProvider &  provider  ) 

This function calculates the centre of the navmesh.

void ChunkWaypoint::clip ( const ChunkWaypointVertexProvider &  provider,
const Chunk *  pChunk,
WorldSpaceVector3 &  wpoint 
) const

This method clips the lpoint to the edge of the waypoint.

Parameters:
pChunk The chunk the waypoint resides.
wpoint Initially this is the point to clip. The point is modified as follows: For each edge that the point is outside of, project the point onto the edge. There are 3 cases: 1) If the point is before the start of the edge, then the clip point is the start since it wasn't a projection point on the previous edge. First edge is special cased. 2) If the point is between the start and end of the edge then this is the clip point. 3) If the projection point is after the end of the edge, then the clip point may be the end point or on the next edge. Leave it for the next edge to decide.

bool ChunkWaypoint::contains ( const ChunkWaypointVertexProvider &  provider,
const WaypointSpaceVector3 &  point 
) const

This method indicates whether or not the waypoint contains the input point.

Parameters:
point The point to test.
Returns:
True if the point is contained inside the waypoint, false otherwise.

bool ChunkWaypoint::containsProjection ( const ChunkWaypointVertexProvider &  provider,
const WaypointSpaceVector3 &  point 
) const

This method indicates whether the input point lies within the waypoint polygon in x-z plane.

Parameters:
point The point to test.
Returns:
True if the point lies inside the waypoint polygon in the x-z plane, false otherwise.

float ChunkWaypoint::distanceSquared ( const ChunkWaypointVertexProvider &  provider,
const Chunk *  pChunk,
const WorldSpaceVector3 &  point 
) const

This method returns the squared distance from waypoint to input point.

Parameters:
pChunk The chunk to search in.
point The point to test.
Returns:
The squared distance from lpoint to the waypoint polygon.

void ChunkWaypoint::makeMaxHeight ( const Chunk *  chunk,
WorldSpaceVector3 &  wpoint 
) const

This method makes the world space point the same height as maxHeight_ of this waypoint in waypoint space.

Parameters:
chunk The chunk the waypoint resides.
wpoint This point will be transformed into waypoint space to do assignment and then transformed back to world space.

void ChunkWaypoint::print ( const ChunkWaypointVertexProvider &  provider  )  const

This method prints some debugging information about this waypoint.

Parameters:
provider The provider to resolve the waypoint vertices.

Member Data Documentation

Vector2 ChunkWaypoint::centre_

This is a point inside the waypoint.

it might not be the exact centre but could be used as an internal point in some cases.

uint16 ChunkWaypoint::edgeCount_

This is the number of edges of the ChunkWaypoint.

DO NOT move this away! DependentArray depends on edgeCount_ to exist on its construction.

Edges ChunkWaypoint::edges_

float ChunkWaypoint::maxHeight_

This is the maximum height of the waypoint.

This is the minimum height of the waypoint.
